description:
Tree Works Application in St Johnâ€™s Conservation Area 13 Cathcart Road, Islington London N19 5QW

An application has been received to do the following tree work at the above address

Front garden:

-	(T88)  Robinia pseudoacacia 'Frisia' 
o	Crown thin 10% by remove deadwood and rubbing and crossing branches.
o	Removal of Ivy on the lower stem.

-	(T101)   Robinia pseudoacacia.
o	Crown lift to 2.5 meters.
o	Crown reduce by 15%
o	Balance crown to leave a natural shape.


Rear garden:

-	(T21) Lime
o	Crown lift to 3.0 meters.
o	Crown reduce by 20% and balance crown leaving a natural shape.
o	Removal of deadwood.

-	(T22) Lime
o	Crown lift to 3.0 meters.
o	Crown reduce by 20% and balance crown leaving a natural shape.
o	Removal of deadwood.

-	(T23) Sycamore- self-seeded
o	Fell to ground level and treat stump.

-	(T24) Elder
o	Coppice to regenerate.

-	(T25) Black Mulberry 
o	Removed deadwood.
o	Crown thin by 10-15% removal of rubbing and crossing branches.

-	(T26) Sycamores (self-seeded) X 5
o	Fell to ground level, treat stumps where appropriate.
decision_conditions: The Mulberry tree must not be pruned during the summer when in leaves, but after leaf fall in the autumn.
